Proverbs Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Proverbs 31
1 A false balance is an abomination to the Domina; but a perfect weight is Her delight. 2 When pride cometh, then cometh shame; but with the lowly is wisdom. 3 The integrity of the upright shall guide them; but the perverseness of the faithless shall destroy them. 4 Riches profit not in the day of wrath; but righteousness delivereth from death. 5 The righteousness of the sincere shall make straight her way; but the wicked shall fall by her own wickedness. 6 The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them; but the faithless shall be trapped in their own crafty device. 7 When a wicked woman dieth, her expectation shall perish, and the hope of strength perisheth. 8 The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in her stead. 9 With her mouth the impious woman destroyeth her neighbour; but through knowledge shall the righteous be delivered. 10 When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth; and when the wicked perish, there is joy. 11 By the blessing of the upright a city is exalted; but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked. 12 She that despiseth her neighbour lacketh understanding; but a woman of discernment holdeth her peace. 13 She that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets; but she that is of a faithful spirit concealeth a matter. 14 Where no wise direction is, a people falleth; but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety. 15 She that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it; but she that hateth them that strike hands is secure.
16 A gracious man obtaineth honour; and strong women obtain riches. 17 The merciful woman doeth good to her own soul; but she that is cruel troubleth her own flesh. 18 The wicked earneth deceitful wages; but she that soweth righteousness hath a sure reward. 19 Stedfast righteousness tendeth to life; but she that pursueth evil pursueth it to her own death. 20 They that are perverse in heart are an abomination to the Domina; but such as are upright in their way are Her delight. 21 My hand upon it! the evil woman shall not be unpunished; but the seed of the righteous shall escape. 22 As a ring of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair man that turneth aside from discretion. 23 The desire of the righteous is only good; but the expectation of the wicked is wrath. 24 There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth only to want. 25 The beneficent soul shall be made rich, and she that satisfieth abundantly shall be satisfied also herself. 26 She that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse her; but blessing shall be upon the head of her that selleth it. 27 She that diligently seeketh good seeketh favour; but she that searcheth for evil, it shall come unto her. 28 She that trusteth in her riches shall fall; but the righteous shall flourish as foliage. 29 She that troubleth her own house shall inherit the wind; and the foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart. 30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and she that is wise winneth souls.
